feed.title: BORIS is an easy-to-use event logging software for video/audio coding and live observations.

entry.title: 2019-05-23: Mini free workshop: Behavioral Analysis with BORIS
entry.content:
Aula 4, Dept. Life Sciences and Systems Biology, Via Accademia Albertina 13, 10123 Torino, Italy. h. 10:00 - 13:00 and 14:00 - 17:00 - Bring your own laptop. 25 places available.
See the above link for the detailed program. Please register at https://framadate.org/woVkIofKthFgmoI9
entry.summary:
Aula 4, Dept. Life Sciences and Systems Biology, Via Accademia Albertina 13, 10123 Torino, Italy. h. 10:00 - 13:00 and 14:00 - 17:00 - Bring your own laptop. 25 places available.

entry.title: 2019-03-30: v. 7.5 is available
entry.content: v. 7.5 is available. Added Needleman-Wunsch similarity between observations and frames extraction corresponding to coded events. Some bugs fixed.
entry.summary: v. 7.5 is available. Added Needleman-Wunsch similarity between observations and frames extraction corresponding to coded events. Some bugs fixed.

entry.title: 2019-03-27: v. 7.4.15 is available
entry.content: v. 7.4.15 is available. Fixed 2 bugs. See the revision history for details.
entry.summary: v. 7.4.15 is available. Fixed 2 bugs. See the revision history for details.

entry.title: 2019-03-20: v. 7.4.14 is available
entry.content: v. 7.4.14 is available. Added waveform visualization. Some improvements and bugs fixed. See the revision history for details.
entry.summary: v. 7.4.14 is available. Added waveform visualization. Some improvements and bugs fixed. See the revision history for details.

entry.title: DORIS is available!
entry.content: DORIS is an easy-to-use interactive objects detection and tracking software with a graphical user interface. It is free and open-source and available for GNU/Linux, Windows and Mac OS.
entry.summary: DORIS is an easy-to-use interactive objects detection and tracking software with a graphical user interface. It is free and open-source and available for GNU/Linux, Windows and Mac OS.
